alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 9:14AM MDT until May 14 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Elbert. In northeast Colorado, Adams, Arapahoe, Morgan and Weld. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry creeks. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 911 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated earlier heavy rain due to showers. This is causing small stream, field and road flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Rain will start to decrease later this morning and early afternoon although the water will remain high through the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northeastern Aurora, Elbert, eastern Denver International Airport, Hudson, Bennett, Elizabeth, Keenesburg, Wiggins, Kiowa, Strasburg, Byers, Manila Village, Watkins, Ponderosa Park, Prospect Valley, Roggen and Fondis.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
